sentences: Suudad sa kuidagi seda aru saada?
context: The word 'suudab' is the third-person singular form of the Estonian verb 'suda', which means 'to know' or 'to be able'. It indicates that someone has the ability, skill, or knowledge to do something. This is similar to the English modal verb 'can' when used in the present tense for a single person (he/she/it).
